1: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] Two small circular gold-tone buttons are visible along the center-front placket of the object’s outer layer, each button with a polished finish and a subtle raised edge. A silver-tone chain strap with interlinked links crosses over the left shoulder and runs to the right hip, its length determined by the upper body position. The chain strap ends connect to the object’s bag at the top corners via small circular metal rings that secure the strap to the bag’s frame. [Side View] The front-placket buttons recur along the side seam as small circular gold-tone elements with a bright, polished finish. The chain strap is visible from the side, composed of interconnected oval and rectangular metal links that maintain a continuous silver-tone appearance. The strap attachments to the bag appear as tiny circular rings at each top corner, acting as the anchor points for the chain. [Bottom View] No hardware elements are clearly visible on the underside of the object in this view.
10: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] A row of circular metal eyelets, polished silver-tone, is visible along the central upper area where the lacing threads; each eyelet is about 6 mm in diameter and is anchored into the upper material with a clean, beveled edge that sits flush with the surface. At the ends of the white laces, small cylindrical aglets of clear white plastic are visible, approximately 1 cm in length, crimped securely over the lace ends to prevent fraying. The eyelets are evenly spaced and align with the lace path across the forefoot, providing the metal hardware through which the laces pass. [Side View] Along the outer side of the object, the same circular silver-tone eyelets appear in a vertical sequence that runs toward the midfoot; each eyelet remains about 6 mm in diameter and is embedded into the upper with a smooth, rounded rim, through which the lace passes, indicating a consistent lace-up hardware design visible from the side. The lace tips retain their small clear plastic aglets at the ends, about 1 cm long, showing a crisp termination point where the laces stop and the eyelets begin or continue past them. [Bottom View] No hardware elements are visible from the bottom view; the underside presents only the sole with a textured tread pattern and lacks any metal components or rings that would be considered hardware. The visible features are limited to the rubber outsole outline and grip pattern rather than any connecting metal pieces.
11: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] Two circular gold-tone rings, approximately 1.8 cm in diameter, are mounted at the top edge on the left and right sides of the object, forming the anchor points for the two black leather handles. Each ring is connected to the body through a short black leather tab that loops through the ring and is secured to the body by stitching. Directly beneath each ring, small gold-tone rivets are visible on the face of the body, securing the leather tabs with a polished, domed finish. [Side View] A single circular gold-tone ring, about 1.8 cm in diameter, sits at the top corner of the side panel and is attached via a black leather loop anchored to the side, providing a secondary attachment point for the handle. The ring is connected to the leather loop, which appears to be a folded piece of black leather stitched to the side panel to hold the attachment in place. [Bottom View] No hardware elements are visible on the bottom from this view.
12: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] A rectangular brass-tone lock plate, approximately 2 cm by 2 cm, sits centered on the lower portion of the front flap of the object, featuring a subtle recessed inner outline and small screw heads at its corners. Two curved leather handle brackets with polished gold-tone metal bases are mounted on either side of the central handle, each base about 1.5 cm wide and secured to the body with small round rivets at the bracket corners. Two gold-tone top-edge clasps, positioned symmetrically near the outer corners along the top edge, have a rounded rectangular form roughly 1 cm tall by 1.5 cm wide and are mounted with small pivot points to secure the lid. A pair of small round gold-tone rivets are visible at the base of each handle bracket, securing the brackets to the top edge. The curved top handle itself is a brown leather arc that sits over the upper center, connected to the body by the two gold-tone bracket pieces described above. [Side View] Hinge assemblies along the upper edge appear as elongated brass-tone rectangular plates with rounded ends, about 2.5 cm long, attached to the sides of the product with small rivets to connect the lid to the body. Small brass-tone strap/shoulder strap anchor loops are visible near the top edge on the side, consisting of compact rectangular attachments that serve as means to attach a detachable strap. Gold-tone corner reinforcement pieces are seen along the side bottom edge, shaped as small curved caps that protect the corners and are affixed with rivets. At the top edge near the hinge, additional small round brass-tone rivets are visible, securing the hinge plates to the body and lid. The side of the handle base is visible as part of the mounting hardware, with a compact brass-tone bracket extending from the body to support the leather handle. [Bottom View] Two circular brass-tone feet are visible at the front corners of the bottom surface, each about 6–7 mm in diameter and attached with small rivets to elevate the object slightly. Small brass-tone corner protection caps are present at the bottom-front edges, shaped as little squared/rounded blocks that reinforce the corners and are riveted to the base. A contiguous line of tiny brass-tone rivets traces the bottom edge where the leather trim is secured, indicating attachment points for the hardware along the base.
13: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] The object features a gold-tone chain strap with medium-sized links that crosses over the chest, and this chain is anchored to the body at two small gold-tone fittings located at the top corners of the smaller crossbody element. A gold-tone rectangular closure with squared edges sits centered on the front flap of the smaller bag-like piece, presenting a polished, high-gloss finish and no visible engraving. At the left side of the visible area, a small gold-tone circular rivet or stud is present near the upper edge of the larger monogram-style segment, showing a smooth, reflective surface. [Side View] From the side, the chain strap continues into a gold-tone connector that links to the top edge of the smaller bag component, appearing as a small rectangular fitting with a brushed-like sheen. The front-closure area on the smaller bag remains visible as a compact gold-tone rectangular element with rounded corners, seen edge-on and maintaining a polished finish. A gold-tone ring or stud near the upper edge of the larger segment remains visible, presenting as a small circular accent. [Bottom View] No hardware elements are visible on the bottom plane of the object.
14: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] Two curved, narrow black ribbon-style handles are attached along the top edge of the white front-facing panel, extending upward and outward with a slight arc, each approximately 1.5 cm in width and anchored at symmetric points near the panel’s center. A thin, solid black stripe runs horizontally across the lower portion of the front panel, about 8–12 mm in height, with clean, straight edges and a flat finish. On the white box positioned to the right of the main panel, a small black rectangular latch sits centered on the front face near the lid seam, featuring a squared, flat profile in matte black. The orange box at the far right displays a small black rectangular feature along its top-front edge, presenting a low-profile, matte finish element that appears to function as a label or grip. [Side View] From the side, the two black ribbon handles appear as thin curved strips attached to the top edge at the outer sides of the object, maintaining their narrow width and outward curvature. The small black rectangular latch on the white box remains visible from the side as a rectangular, matte-black contour near the lid seam, indicating its placement across the front face. The orange box on the far right shows a concise black rectangular feature along its top-front edge, consistent with a subtle label/closure element in matte black. [Bottom View] No hardware elements are visible from the bottom view.
15: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] Two small circular elements, gold-tone and highly polished, sit side-by-side on the front-facing area; each is about 1 cm in diameter, with smooth curved rims, and they are arranged with a tiny gap between them to form a near-full circular motif centered along the lower portion of the visible surface. [Side View] From the side, the same double-circle hardware projects slightly from the surface, appearing as a single unit with two rounded lobes; the pieces retain a bright, reflective gold-tone finish and are positioned close to the lower edge, aligned along the object’s edge line. [Bottom View] At the bottom portion of the visible surface, the twin gold-tone circular elements are again visible, maintaining their polished finish and a small gap between the two lobes, arranged in a side-by-side configuration.
16: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] The object features a silver-tone telescoping handle composed of two parallel rails that rise from the top edge, with a rectangular black grip at the top end to form the retractable lifting point. A horizontal zipper runs along the upper portion of the front face, featuring a small rectangular, polished-silver zipper pull with a circular opening at its end. Near the top center of the front panel, a small flat rectangular emblem plate sits flush against the surface, offering a subtle branding detail in a dark finish. At the lower corners, two circular wheels are visible, mounted on short axles and partially recessed into black wheel housings that are integrated with the base. [Side View] The object shows the same two parallel silver-tone rails of the telescoping handle from the side, with the rectangular black grip at the top end visible above the top edge. The wheel assembly is seen from the side as a circular wheel with a rubber tire, attached by a metal axle into a small supporting bracket at the base. No additional exterior hardware is clearly visible on this side beyond the handle rails and the wheel housing, indicating a clean side profile. [Bottom View] From the bottom perspective, the two wheels are again visible as circular components with a dark tire and a lighter center, attached to short metal axles that connect into wheel housings at the base corners. The wheel housings project slightly beyond the bottom edge, forming small rounded protrusions where the wheels are mounted.
17: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] The object features two pale pink, rounded handles that form semi-circular loops, each mounted at the top edge near the far left and far right positions to permit hand grip. Each handle is anchored by a pale pink leather tab that overlaps the top edge, and the tab surfaces show two small circular silver-tone rivets securing the connection to the body. The rivets are roughly 0.5 cm in diameter, with a polished, reflective finish that contrasts with the matte pink leather of the tabs. The visible hardware thus consists of two pairings of circular rivet heads on the front-facing side of the attachment tabs, located at the inner corners of the left and right top edges. [Side View] Along the top edge of the side face, a single small circular silver-tone rivet is visible where the corresponding handle attachment tab meets the body, measuring approximately 0.5 cm in diameter with a polished finish. The side view also reveals a portion of the pale pink leather tab that extends from the top edge to accommodate the handle, appearing as a narrow, curved strip that abuts the body and transitions into the attachment area where the rivet resides. [Bottom View] No hardware elements are visible in this view.
18: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] The object shows two small rectangular silver-tone metal brackets at the top corners where the leather handles are anchored to the body, each bracket measuring roughly 2 cm wide by 0.8 cm tall with rounded edges, and the leather handle ends pass into and are secured by these brackets with visible small rivets. A silver-tone horizontal zipper runs across the very top opening; the teeth are fine and evenly spaced, and the pull is a slender rectangular tab with a small circular hole at its end, both finished in a polished silver tone. [Side View] A circular silver-tone D-ring sits near the top edge on the outer side, attached via a short leather tab and secured to the body, serving as a strap attachment point. The top edge of the product shows the continuation of the same silver-tone zipper from the front, visible along the side seam where the opening curves, with consistent finish and a small rectangular pull at the end. [Bottom View] Two circular silver-tone feet are visible on the bottom corners, providing lift and stabilization, each foot appearing as a small domed disc with a polished metal finish.
19: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] A matte-black D-shaped ring is anchored at the upper right corner of the front panel by a short black fabric tab, serving as a strap attachment point for the main harness. A single matte-black rectangular buckle sits on a vertical front-center strap, about 2 cm tall, and is fastened to the strap with a stitched loop; the buckle includes a small prong that engages the strap. Two gunmetal-gray zipper pulls lie along the top edge of the lower front pocket; each pull is a small oblong rectangle with rounded ends and a circular hole for gripping. A small matte-black rivet is visible at the base of the vertical strap, about 0.5 cm in diameter. A slim matte-black loop keeper sits beside the buckle, functioning to secure the strap tail. [Side View] A side compression strap crosses the side mid-height and features a matte-black rectangular buckle, approximately 2 cm wide and 1.2 cm tall, attached by two short fabric tabs. Near the top edge on the side, a circular matte-black D-ring is mounted via a black fabric loop, with the ring about 1.5 cm in diameter. The main shoulder strap area shows a black plastic slider on the strap for length adjustment; the slider is a small rectangular piece with a central slot. [Bottom View] Two small black plastic feet are visible at the front corners of the base; each foot is roughly 1 cm in diameter and sits flush against the bottom surface. There is no additional hardware visible along the bottom edge beyond these feet.
2: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] A row of small circular eyelets is embedded along the front-lacing panel, appearing as tiny rings with a dark matte finish and a subtle metallic edge where they anchor the lacing hardware into the fabric. Neon-green flat laces pass through these eyelets, looping over the tongue area as they are being tightened, and the laces themselves form bright, flat segments crossing the upper surface. At the tips of the neon-green laces, short cylindrical aglets are visible, finished in a glossy translucent green and terminating the lace ends with a compact, rounded shape. [Side View] A slim, rectangular pull-tab is mounted toward the back of the upper, colored in the same neon-green as the laces, and secured by a single stitch along its base to the heel area. The lateral surface shows a continuation of small circular eyelets aligned along the lacing path, each eyelet projecting slightly from the fabric and set in a dark frame that contrasts with the surrounding material. The neon-green laces pass through these eyelets in a diagonal run toward the toe, with the metallic-looking aglets again visible at the lace ends. [Bottom View] The underside reveals the outer edge of the outsole with a narrow neon-green trim that runs along the perimeter, forming a bright contrast against the darker rubber. Near the toe region, small circular contact nodes or indentations are faintly visible on the outsole’s surface, indicating patterned tread elements that interact with the floor. The front toe area shows the lace ends partially resting above the bottom surface, with the aglets not in direct contact with the floor but visible at the periphery of the toe box area.
20: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] A gold-tone rectangular buckle with rounded corners is mounted on the left vertical leather strap that runs from the flap toward the bottom, and its prong lies inside the strap hole to secure the strap; the buckle is roughly 1.8 cm wide by 2.2 cm tall and has a polished brass finish with a narrow central bar guiding the strap. A second identical gold-tone rectangular buckle with rounded corners is mounted on the right vertical leather strap, mirroring the left side, and it also uses a single prong to pass through the strap’s holes; this buckle matches the left in size (about 1.8 cm by 2.2 cm) and has the same polished brass appearance. Two circular antique-brass rings sit at the top corners where the handle attaches to the body, acting as anchor points for the leather handle via short leather tabs; each ring is approximately 1.5 cm in diameter and is secured to the body with a small brass rivet on each side. A small silver-br tone logo plate is centered on the upper front portion of the flap, shaped as a compact horizontal plaque with etched branding, and is fastened to the leather with two tiny rivets at its ends. Two tiny brass rivets are visible near the top edge of the front panel, one on each side above where the buckle straps emerge, serving as anchor points for the front-facing hardware. A left-side detachable strap anchor is visible as a silver-toned ring attached to a leather tab at the bag’s left edge, with a small metal clasp passing through the ring to connect a shoulder strap; the ring is about 1.6 cm in diameter and is held by a leather tab secured with a rivet. [Side View] Along the top opening, a gold-tone zipper spans the width of the object, with a rectangular zipper slider visible toward the center; the teeth are exposed along the edge and the finish of the slider matches the warm brass tone of the other hardware. A small, square-ish metal buckle on the inner side of the side edge is visible when partially opened; it is gold-tone with a polished finish, about 1.5 cm across, and connects a short leather tab to the top edge to assist in securing the opening. A slim, gold-tone rectangular logo plate is seen on the interior face near the top center, with a subtle engraved brand mark; it is fastened by tiny rivets at its ends and sits flush against the leather. A silver-toned D-shaped ring is visible toward the outer side, attached to a leather hanger via a short metal post; the ring is roughly 2 cm in diameter and is used to attach a shoulder strap. [Bottom View] A single small gold-tone foot is visible near the front-right corner along the bottom edge; it appears as a rounded cylindrical stud about 0.6–0.8 cm tall that secures the bottom surface to prevent wear.
21: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] The lipstick is shown as a cylindrical black tube with a glossy finish; the bullet itself is exposed at the top and has a pointed red tip, approximately 1.2–1.4 cm visible above the lip of the tube. The cap is a separate cylindrical piece, same black finish as the tube, positioned in the other hand and aligned along the tube’s length so the two pieces would slide together to enclose the lipstick; the cap’s top edge is rounded and its diameter is just slightly smaller than the tube’s body to allow a snug fit. Along the visible edge of the ornate frame surrounding the mirror, a raised decorative motif runs in a curved, scroll-like pattern at the top-left area; this ornament appears as a white-painted relief with subtle depth, extending about 4–6 cm along the frame’s inner curve and providing a glossy, high-contrast decorative accent against the frame. [Side View] From the side, the lipstick tube presents as a slim, rectangular silhouette with rounded ends when viewed edge-on; the body is black with a smooth, polished surface, and there is a clearly defined seam where the cap would slide onto the base, indicating the two pieces connect by a standard friction-fit cap-to-tube design. The frame’s edge is visible along the side as a narrow, curved profile with a raised beaded or fluted detailing immediately inside the outer edge, contributing a subtle textured line along the perimeter of the mirror. [Bottom View] At the bottom edge of the object, a small circular fastener or rivet is visible where the frame meets the stand area; this element appears as a tiny silver-toned circle embedded flush with the surface, serving as a connector or hinge point between the frame and its support. The overall bottom perimeter shows the continuation of the ornate frame profile, but the most distinct hardware element in this view is the small round fastener described above.
22: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] A cylindrical, polished gold-tone cap sits centered on the top portion of the object, with a flat top surface that reflects light and a seamless, smooth side profile. A narrow dark ring encircles the base of the cap, creating a visible transition between the cap and the body. [Side View] From the side, the cap retains a uniform cylindrical silhouette with a high-gloss gold finish, extending noticeably above the bottle’s top. The same thin dark ring around the base of the cap is visible, continuing around the circumference and marking the junction between cap and body. [Bottom View] No hardware elements are visible from this view; the bottom presents as a plain circular surface without observable attachments or embellishments.
24: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] The cap is a short, circular cylindrical piece finished in glossy black, positioned at the top center of the object’s neck; its surface is smooth and uninterrupted, with a subtle seam visible at the base where it meets the neck, indicating a screw-on attachment. A slender, colorless glass pipette extends downward from the cap into the body of the object, with a uniform diameter and a fine rounded tip that sits just outside the mouth area; the pipette appears to be securely seated in the cap through a tight seal, forming a continuous, unobtrusive line from cap to the interior. The connection between the cap and the pipette is seamless, suggesting the pipette is integrated as part of the cap assembly rather than a separate detachable piece. [Side View] The cap is seen from the side as a dark, circular cylinder clamped atop the neck of the object; its exterior surface is glossy and reflects light, with a visible circular edge at the outer perimeter and a slight underside contour where it meets the neck, indicating a screw-fit attachment. The glass pipette exits the cap at a shallow angle, continuing toward the left and downward; the pipette remains colorless with a consistent diameter, and its tip is rounded just beyond the cap’s edge, indicating the dispensing end. The pipette is anchored to the cap with a tight, flush interface, forming a single, uninterrupted line along the cap’s side and into the neck region of the object. [Bottom View] No hardware elements are visible from the bottom view; the base presents as a plain circular surface of the transparent body with a smooth, flat underside and no protruding fittings or components.
25: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] A rectangular, blocky cap in a highly polished silver finish sits squarely on top of the object, with flat top faces and sharp edges, projecting slightly beyond the bottle’s width. Directly beneath the cap, a slim, metallic collar forms a bright, reflective ring around the neck, appearing as a distinct transition piece with a comparable silver finish. On the front face of the glass body, a small white rectangular label is affixed and centered, featuring black text, serving as an auxiliary decorative element rather than structural hardware. [Side View] From the side, the cap remains a rectangular block with clean, beveled edges and a mirror-like silver surface, visible along the side faces. Just under the cap, the neck collar appears as a thin, circular metallic band wrapping around the neck, sharing the same polished silver finish and providing a subtle visual separation between cap and body. The front-facing label’s edge is seen as a narrow white line along the side of the bottle, indicating its rectangular shape and centered position on the front. [Bottom View] No hardware elements are visible from the bottom view; the base is a flat, clear glass surface without protruding metallic or structural components.
28: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] A white circular frame forms the display’s outer boundary, and along its circumference are white rectangular mounting blocks that are evenly spaced and appear to be fixed directly to the ring. Each mounting block extends slightly upward and holds a nail-polish bottle by its base, acting as a dedicated support for the item. The nail-polish bottles themselves display square-ish glass bodies with a colored liquid visible inside, and they are topped with glossy black cylindrical caps that sit centered on the bottle necks. The black caps have a smooth, polished finish and are vertically oriented, creating a strong contrast against the light mounting blocks and the pale background. The overall arrangement shows the bottles attached to the ring in a radial pattern, with each bottle’s cap projecting outward from the center of the display. [Side View] From the side, the white mounting blocks project a short distance from the circular ring, appearing as small upright rectangular protrusions that connect to the ring and hold the bottle bodies above the surface. The bottle tops remain visible as black cylindrical caps, which appear as slender, rounded rectangles due to perspective, and they sit flush atop the bottle necks. The nail-polish bottles’ color-filled glass bodies are seen behind the caps, giving a glimpse of the varied tint through the side of each bottle. The overall side view emphasizes the connection point where each bottle attaches to its white mounting block, with the ring forming a slim continuous edge behind the elements. [Bottom View] No additional hardware elements are clearly visible from the bottom view; the underside presents the returning edges of the white mounting blocks around the circle, appearing as small rectangular shapes with minimal detail. The interior of the display remains largely unobstructed in this view, with only the lower portions of the mounts and the ring’s edge observable.
29: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] A circular, clear pink-tinted rim forms the outer edge of the lid, about 5 millimeters wide and surrounding the entire circular component where the mirror sits, and it is glued to the main body via a thin transparent joint along the perimeter. A short, curved metallic hingepiece in polished silver is visible along the upper-left quadrant of the circle, connecting the lid to the base and appearing as a small crescent-shaped extension with a rounded pivot. A small rectangular silver latch sits along the front bottom edge of the base, flush with the surface, and appears to engage with the lid to hold the unit closed when shut. Inside the lid, a circular mirror is visible, its reflective surface showing a gold-toned script logo across the center, with a smooth, glossy finish around the logo area. Resting in front of the object is a circular white powder puff with a soft, plush texture and a pale pink edge around its circumference; the puff is held near the front face and appears to be loosely pressed against the surface for application. To the left side of the base, a small rectangular transparent container with a pale pink liquid is partially visible, featuring a shiny metallic silver cap; the container is aligned vertically and held at a slight angle by the fingers, suggesting it is an accessory accessory close to the object rather than part of its core mechanism. [Side View] From the side, the circular rim of the lid reads as a thin, continuous edge with a faint rose-tinted hue, indicating a clear pink sleeve around the circumference; the silver hinge is seen as a shallow curved projection along the upper edge, providing the pivot point for opening the lid. The base appears slightly thicker than the lid, with the same translucent pink surface visible along the side edge, and the silver latch at the front bottom edge is visible in profile as a small rectangular block that tucks into a corresponding recess on the lid. The circular mirror inside the lid remains visible at the interior face, though seen from an angled perspective, with the gold logo still faintly perceptible along the reflective surface. The circular puff is visible in profile as a thin disk with a small thickness and the pink-edged perimeter remains noticeable from this angle as it rests against the object during use. The small rectangular bottle-like accessory near the base is seen in profile as a transparent cuboid with a reflective cap, its flat faces and clear sides catching light as it sits adjacent to the object. [Bottom View] The bottom edge shows a shallow, flat profile with a small rounded foot at the front, contributing to the object’s stability when placed on a surface. A tiny circular foot or cap is repeated near the opposite side, indicating multiple support points along the base’s underside. The small rectangular metallic latch mentioned from the front view is not visible from this angle, but the hinge area along the base’s side remains detectable as a subtle metal seam around the lower circumference. The base’s underside does not reveal additional branding or engraving beyond the clean, smooth finish of the case, while the adjacent accessory container’s bottom cap remains out of view from this perspective.
30: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] A glossy black cylindrical cap with a flat circular face is visible at the lower end of the object, approximately 1 cm in diameter, and it connects to a straight white applicator stem. The thin white stem extends from the cap toward the upper-right, being smooth and uniform in diameter about 2–3 mm, with a crisp transition where it meets the cap. At the distant end of the stem sits a teardrop-shaped applicator pad with a pink-tinted surface, slightly curved and flush with the tip of the stem. 32: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] A circular ear cup on the left side presents a black matte face with a thin brushed-silver ring running along its outer circumference, and a dense black padding band visible around the speaker opening on the inner edge. A second circular ear cup on the right mirrors the same circular shape, black matte finish, narrow metallic ring, and plush black interior padding. A curved, slender headband arches across the top, colored black and attaching to each ear cup via a small metallic hinge at the outer edge. The hinges themselves are small cylindrical pieces finished in brushed silver, located at the junction where the headband meets the ear cups, with tiny screw heads visible on the hinge plates. A stitched seam line traces the inner edge of the padding around each ear cup, delineating the soft contact surface from the hard outer housing. [Side View] A side-facing hinge is visible where the ear cup meets the headband, appearing as a small brushed-silver cylindrical pivot that allows rotation, with its axis running horizontally along the connection. The ear cup side face remains circular, maintaining the black outer surface and the slim silver-edged rim that follows the circumference. The headband side reveals a low-profile, continuous black band with a discrete, metallic attachment near the hinge, anchoring the ear cup to the band. The interior padding along the ear cup’s inner edge is partially visible from the side, showing a stacked layering where the soft surface meets the hard outer shell. [Bottom View] No additional hardware elements are clearly visible from the bottom view.
33: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] A circular earcup is visible on the left side of the frame, featuring a dark recessed center disc surrounded by a light gray ring and a separate polished silver-tone outer rim along the circumference. A thin white fabric-covered cable exits from the bottom edge of the earcup, descending straight downward toward the wearer. A white padded crown band runs across the top of the frame, with a soft rectangular cushion visible along the top center where it contacts the head. A small dark gray hinge or yoke connects the earcup to the headband at the upper outer edge, allowing rotation and adjustment. On the outer face of the earcup, there appears to be a circular control element—a raised disk with a recessed center—set roughly mid‑face for interaction. [Side View] The right earcup is seen in profile as a circular shell with a pronounced depth; the outer edge shows a metallic-looking ring while the main face remains darker under the lighting, giving a two-tone appearance. A light gray hinge/connector attaches the earcup to the headband just above the ear, enabling swivel movement; this joint is visible as a small block-like element linking the two components. The white headband behind the earcup is shown with a visible seam and a light padding strip along its inner surface, indicating a cushioned contact area. The white cable is seen running from the bottom of the earcup, hanging down past the jawline, and traveling toward the body’s midline. [Bottom View] From the bottom viewpoint, the earcup shell forms a smooth, curved underside where the white cable enters near the lower edge at about the 4–5 o’clock position; the entry point is a small circular port or opening flush with the shell. The bottom edge of the earcup presents a rounded, matte surface with no visible fasteners, while the cable exit is clearly integrated into the shell’s lower perimeter. The headband’s underside shows a narrow, flat padding strip running along its length as part of the contact surface between the product and the wearer’s head.
34: MVREF A multi-view reference showing: [Front View] A circular, matte-black ear cup on the right side features a small white oval badge with black text affixed to its outer surface, which sits flush against the cup’s skin-colored edge and is clearly visible from the front. A second circular ear cup on the left mirrors the same matte-black finish and size, connected to a slim, curved headband that arcs over the top of the object. A large round microphone pop filter with a thin black ring is centered between the microphone and the face, its circular shape surrounding a fine mesh screen that sits just behind the ring’s edge. The microphone itself is a smooth, cylindrical body in matte black, roughly 5–6 centimeters tall, with a circular grille at the top that shows a knurled or perforated metal pattern beneath its surface. Encasing the microphone is a black shock mount composed of multiple slender crossbars and elastic cords forming a cradle around the cylindrical body, all of which attach to a black gooseneck arm that curves forward from a desk clamp. The gooseneck consists of two or more segmented cylindrical sections joined by pivot points, allowing the mic to tilt toward the user. A separate rigid black desk clamp anchors the gooseneck to the table, featuring a rounded grip area and a tightening screw that secures the arm in place. A black, slender cable runs from the left ear cup down across the chest, clearly visible against the shirt, indicating an audio connection inherent to the object. The headband itself is a narrow, matte-black strip that arches over the top of the head, with small black brackets at each ear cup where the cups rotate or hinge for fit. Along the midfoot section, a sequence of small circular eyelets can be seen embedded in the upper, each with a polished metallic finish and evenly spaced to guide the lacing path; these eyelets align in a curved line following the side contour of the object and are used to pass the laces across the midfoot. The lateral heel counter area is reinforced with a curved structural piece that forms a distinct edge where the upper meets the sole, providing a hard-contrast accent rather than a decorative element, and it visually separates the heel from the midsole. [Bottom View] No hardware elements are clearly visible from this view; the underside presents only the outsole contact area without discernible metal or plastic fittings, fasteners, or attachment hardware, so there are no described hardware components to enumerate in this view.
